column4: UPDATE 2-Tiffany ordered to pay Swatch $449 mln in damages  cuts outlook
column5: ZURICH/NEW YORK  Dec 22 Tiffany & Co on Sunday said a Dutch arbitration court ruled that it must pay Swatch Group 402 million Swiss francs ($448.79 million) in damages over their failed joint venture to produce and market watches  and the New York-based jeweler slashed its profit outlook for the year.

column4: Disney cuts CEO pay  adds Twitter co-founder to board
column5: Walt Disney Co has slashed Chief Executive Bob Iger's fiscal 2013 compensation by 15 percent with a bonus cut  and named Twitter Inc co-founder Jack Dorsey an independent board director.

column4: UPDATE 1-Disney cuts CEO pay  adds Twitter co-founder to board
column5: Dec 23 Walt Disney Co has slashed Chief Executive Bob Iger's fiscal 2013 compensation by 15 percent with a bonus cut  and named Twitter Inc co-founder Jack Dorsey an independent board director.

column4: Disney names Twitter co-founder Dorsey to board
column5: Dec 23 Walt Disney Co has named Jack Dorsey  co-founder of Twitter Inc and chief executive of payments startup Square Inc  as an independent board member.

column4: Alibaba rival JD.com to top sales target as Chinese shoppers flock to Internet
column5: BEIJING JD.com  China's second-largest e-commerce site  is set to exceed 100 billion yuan ($16.47 billion) in annual sales for the first time in a market that has drawn investment from global retailing names such as Amazon and Wal-Mart.

column4: Disney CEO gets 15 pct pay cut despite "strong results"
column5: Dec 23 Walt Disney Co CEO Bob Iger's compensation was cut 15 percent to $34.3 million in fiscal 2013  despite what its board said on Monday were strong results during the year.

column4: Rio Tinto mulls selling stake in Pebble owner Northern Dynasty
column5: LONDON  Dec 23 Global miner Rio Tinto  said on Monday it is considering the sale of its stake in Canada's Northern Dynasty  owner of the undeveloped Pebble copper-gold project in Alaska.
